meanings.definition: A unit of force in the foot-pound-second system equal to the force required to accelerate a mass of one pound at a rate of one foot per second squared.
meanings.sent1: She measured the force in poundals needed to move the object.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the impact force in poundals during the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The poundals in the equation were causing quite a commotion in the physics class.
meanings.sent4: The poundals of pressure on the bridge made it creak ominously.
meanings.sent5: The concept of poundals helped her understand the strength needed to lift heavy objects.

meanings.definition: A unit of work or energy equal to the work done by a force of one poundal acting through a distance of one foot.
meanings.sent1: The machine's efficiency was measured in poundals of work per minute.
meanings.sent2: He calculated the energy output in poundals for the entire process.
meanings.sent3: The poundals of energy seemed to dance around the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The poundals of effort she put in were evident in the final result.
meanings.sent5: The image of poundals at work stayed with him long after the project was completed.
